intro: Arnebia decumbens, commonly known as the red sandalwood or red root, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant features fleshy, lance-shaped leaves and produces striking red or pink flowers. It is adapted to survive in dry conditions, with deep roots that help it access moisture. Arnebia decumbens is also valued for its medicinal properties in traditional medicine.
